Row.Text: [b]Autocracy[/b]: Additionally, Monuments give +1 Production and +1 Food if the city has a specialty district [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] [b]Merchant Republic[/b]: 1 Military, 2 Economic, 1 Diplomatic, and 2 Wild slots (from 1/2/2/1) [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] [b]Monarchy[/b]: removed +2 Diplo Favor from Renaissance Walls. Add +2 Culture for each Renaissance Walls. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] [b]Communism[/b]: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] 2 Military, 3 Economic, 1 Diplomatic, 2 Wild Slots (from 3/3/1/1) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] +1 Production per citizen (from 0.6) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Collectivization[/b]:+4 production (from +2) and +4 Gold (from +0) per domestic trade route [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Negative tourism modifier increased to 50% (from 40%) [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] [b]Fascism[/b]: combat bonus works on defense [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] [b]Corporate Libertarianism[/b]: remove -10% science malus, add +5 Aluminum/Oil/Uranium per turn [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] [b]Digital Democracy[/b]: remove -3 combat strength malus, add +2 tourism per specialty district [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] [b]Synthetic Technocracy[/b]: remove -10% tourism malus, add +50% production toward Spaceports, Industrial Zones, Campuses, Harbors, and also buildings inside those districts.

[ICON_BULLET] [b]Unit Production Congress:[/b] Modified to +50% cost in production / gold / faith (from +100%) or -25% cost in production / gold / faith (from -50%) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Border Control Treaty:[/b] Vote A - Can purchase tiles at a 50% Gold discount (from culture bomb when completing districts) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Trade Treaty:[/b] Vote A - Now should correctly give +4 gold to players sending trade routes to the target and the target gets +1 trade route. Previously this was the text, but firaxis had it coded that the target got the +4 gold as well as the trade route and other players received nothing. [NEWLINE] Vote B - changed to "-4 gold on Trade Routes sent to/from target player" [i](note: this can result in negative gpt trade routes)[/i] [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Combat strength resolution:[/b] Down to -+3 strength (from -+5)

[ICON_BULLET] [b]Bastions[/b]: +0 city ranged strength (from +5) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Communications Office[/b]: +2 loyalty per governor promotion (from +1) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Discipline[/b]: Combat bonus against barbarian buffed to +10 (from +5) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Limes[/b]: never gets obsolete, +50% production toward walls (from 100%) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Medina Quarter[/b]: +1 Housing per District (from +2 Housing in cities with 3 specialty districts) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Military First[/b]: Unlocked at Mobilization (from Rapid Deployment) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Praetorium[/b]: +20% production on conquered cities with a governor and +4 loyalty for governors (from +2). [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Rationalism[/b], [b]Grand Opera[/b], [b]Simultaneum[/b] and [b]Free Market[/b]: Require 13 pop (from 15), and adjacency bonus of +3 (from +4) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Retinues[/b] and [b]Force Modernization[/b]: -50% of resource cost to both produce and upgrade units (from upgrade only) [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] All Strategic Resource policy cards now give a base +2 of the resource, in addition to the normal +1 by worked resource. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] All Melee and Ranged unit production policy cards now also include Recon units. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] [u]3 new cards to boost Siege Unit production:[/u] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Siegecraft[/b]: Available at Military Tradition, +50% production towards ancient, classical and medieval era siege units. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Hard-shell Explosives[/b]: Available at Medieval Faires, +50% production towards siege units from renaissance era and before. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Trench Warfare[/b]: Available at Scorched Earth, +50% production towards all siege units [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Colonial Offices[/b]: +15% faster growth, +10% Production and 3 Loyalty per turn for cities 8 tiles away from your capital. [Obsolete at Colonialism] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Sovereign Trade[/b]: Open borders with all city states (obsolete at Ideology, as Ideology gives open borders with all city states), unlocked at Civil Service. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Gunboat Diplomacy[/b]: +4 points Influence points per turn toward earning Envoys and +1 Gold from each of your Envoys at city-states. (removed the open borders with city states but merged the card with Merchant Confederation). Merchant Confederation is now obsolete at Ideology [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Raj[/b]: +1 Prod, Food and +2 Science, Culture, Faith and Gold for Trade Route to city-states. (old bonus removed)

[ICON_BULLET] Droughts and Tornados removed entirely [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Meteors removed on all disaster settings except for disaster 4 [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Reduced odds of completely pillaging a district and improvement on disasters [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Natural disasters won't kill civilian units other than rare circumstances with natural wonders [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Production yields from floods reduced to compensate the [b]Watermill[/b] change [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Forest Fire: +1 Food for Woods fires. +1 Production for Rainforest fires (from +1 food and +1 production for all forest fires) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Disaster level 0 now prevents all disasters from occurring (from just a low percentage) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Disaster level 1 now gives the disaster frequency that level 0 used to have [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Flood yields reduced by 25%.

[ICON_BULLET][b]Battering Ram / Siege Tower[/b]: Obsolete at Military Science (from Civil Engineering) [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Military Engineer[/b] [NEWLINE] [/t][ICON_BULLET] 3 movement (from 2) [NEWLINE] [/t][ICON_BULLET] 3 charges (from 2) [NEWLINE] [/t][ICON_BULLET] Can build roads without using a charge [NEWLINE] [/t][ICON_BULLET] Railroads moved to Scientific Theory (from Steam Power) [NEWLINE] [/t][ICON_BULLET] Tunnels moved to Military Science (from Chemistry) [NEWLINE] [/t][ICON_BULLET] Military Engineers can use a charge to complete 50% of a city's flood barrier production (from 20%) [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Medic[/b]: Moved to Military Science (from Sanitation), grants +1 movement to melee, anti-cav, and ranged units (from +0) [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Anti-Air Gun[/b]: Unlocked at Steel (from Advanced Ballistics) [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Mobile SAM[/b]: +115 Anti-air combat strength (from +100) and -5 Anti-air combat strength vs all planes (total = +110 from +100)

[ICON_BULLET] When a spy is captured, you gain +1 spy capacity. This is because in multiplayer, especially team games, there is no way of getting your spy back unlike if it is killed. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Spy production scales with techs/civics (from previous number of copies). Spies are now stackable (Fixed a bug where Wu Zetian could not faith buy spies when there was an opponent spy already in the city). [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] "Neutralize Governor" and "Sabotage Production" mission duration increased to 6 turns [from 4]

Yields from pillaging Districts and Improvements reduced: [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET]-20% on Districts. [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET]-30% on Improvements. [NEWLINE] All improvements correctly give tourism at flight equal to their culture value unless stated otherwise, this is a fix to a Firaxis bug. [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Fishing Boats[/b]: give +1 production. [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Fisheries[/b]: moved to Celestial Navigation (from Liang promote). +1 Housing (from +0.5) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Fort[/b]: Now gives +1 vision and unlocked at Military Engineering (from Siege Tactics). Vision also includes unique forts (Pa, Great Wall, Alcazar) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Lumber Mill[/b]: +1 production at Ballistics and Synthetic Materials (from Steel and Cybernetics). [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Plantations[/b]: gives +1 production if built on a flat tile. Food bonus delayed to Medieval Faires (from Feudalism) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Geothermal Plant[/b]: moved to Chemistry (from Synthetic Materials; +3 power (from +4), additional +3 power and +1 science at Synthetic Materials) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Quarry[/b]: +1 production at Military Engineering (from Gunpowder), +2 production at Rocketry (from +1 Rocketry and +1 Predictive Systems) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Railroads[/b]: cost 1 iron (from 1 iron 1 coal), unlocked at Scientific Theory (from Steam Power) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Seaside Resorts[/b]: minimum appeal of charming (from breathtaking), can be built on hills, tourism and gold equal to 150% of appeal (from 100%)
UD campus replacements (Seowon and Observatory) now get +2 adjacency from geothermal fissures

[ICON_BULLET] +2 Combat Strength per turn of fortification up to a maximum of +4CS (from +3CS per turn up to a maximum of +6CS) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Land units no longer provide support bonus in water [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Melee ancient era unit (Warrior and UUs, Scout and UU, Galley and UU, WarCart and Sabum) get -5 against city center until a classical technology is reached
